column4: I have no sound it gnome, what do I do to get it, I'm using a RealTek ALC880 sound card.
is the sound working outside gnome ?
Nope
are you sure you have a kernel module loaded (if avaliable) for that specific sound card
errrrm, well I don't have hotplug running but I don't think that has anything to do with it.
if so are you using alsay ? if so have you checked dmesg and or alsa log files
s/alsay/alsa/
ehhhh ? :-/
well, ubuntu has prolly a splash screen .. right ? (i havent installed it yet)
so you dont see the boot messages right ?
I do, I done this from a server install
you might have a look into /var/log/messages and see if there are any error messages concerning loading or using the sound card
Ok *looks*
if not, try "# dmesg" on a root console to see if there are any errors during boot time (sound card related errors that is)
hmmmm I don't see anything to do with the sound card in '/var/log/messages'
try `dmesg | less` in a root console and check if you find some sound card (or sc module) related info there
i'll bb in 5
Ok

i can't give you ubuntu specific information but as a long time linux user i'd guess the kernel module for your card is not loaded. you can either `modprobe` it once you know which module you need (as Mr. google[tm]  what module you need). when you know it you might configure it in /etc/modules* so it is laoded at boot time. if you have the module loaded successfully and sound still doesnt work it might be ALSA related ... check /user/local
hmmm Gnome does not list any sound devices
so it is quiet possible that your card is not supported off the shelf by ubuntu ...
oh well I don't need the sound to have fun with ubuntu :P
maybe an ubuntu fan boy knows an easy way to get it done ...
lol
